monogr.title: Sir Philip Sydneys ouránia : that is, Endimions song and tragedie, containing all philosophie. Written by N.B
monogr.author: Baxter, Nathaniel

div.head:
To the Right Worshipfull, and vertuous Lady, the Lady Anne Daniell wife to the Right worshipfull Sir William Daniel •
Knight one of his Majesties Iustices of the Common-Pleas.
div.l: RIght vertuous Lady, health and happinesse,
Doth wish to thee, though hee be in distresse,
Of such as glorie in his Miserie.
He found thy Knight a Patrone in his griefe,
Of men excelling in that facultie.
There lyeth some secret hidden misterie▪
That wit of mortall man cannot vnfolde,
And learned men, are Measur'd by their golde,
Happily Ourania shall vntwine this string,
Good Ladie reade her booke, and heare her sing.
